svg.content: <mxfile userAgent="Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) draw.io/9.3.1 Chrome/66.0.3359.181 Electron/3.0.6 Safari/537.36" version="9.4.2" editor="www.draw.io" type="device"><diagram id="20a90528-6a87-31d9-f4f3-81bacbe820fa" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 320px; max-width: 230px; width: 230px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.p: The positional abilities of parameters still can be handled in the map space. With sensors and devices deployed in a location inside a habitation unit gives out information pertaining to that habitation unit.Â

p.span: This contextual information is key for providing insights to how the system functions and behaves. It also helps in defining control loops specifically for different electrical control equipment.

div.p: A clearer example is the control of ventilation equipment within a habitation unit.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 28px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 68px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 106px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
